titleStmt.title: Mr. Wallers speech in the House of Commons, on Tuesday the fourth of July, 1643. Being brought to the Barre, and having leave given him by the speaker, to say what hee could for himselfe, before they proceeded to expell him the House. Iuly 14. 1643. Imprimatur, John White.
titleStmt.author: Waller, Edmund, 1606-1687.

notesStmt.note: Concerns charges of treason brought against him.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
